example.eg: We are bound by the terms of the contract.
example.egtrans: 我们受合同条款约束。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 受约束的，受到义务束缚的

example.eg: Judges are bound to the law.
example.egtrans: 法官们受法律约束。

example.eg: The cruise ship was bound for New York.
example.egtrans: 这艘游艇是驶向纽约的。

dsense.name: -bound
dsense.guideword: as suffix (heading towards a place) (后缀，意为“开往”，“朝着…方向开”)

example.eg: This train is London-bound.
example.egtrans: 这趟火车是开往伦敦方向的。

example.eg: Luis always knew that he was bound for fame and fortune.
example.egtrans: 路易斯明白他注定会名利双收。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 一定会...的, 注定会...的

example.eg: Before the advent of bound books, long texts were written on scrolls.
example.egtrans: 书籍装订发明之前，长文本一般写在卷轴上。

example.eg: This book is bound in antique leather.
example.egtrans: 这本书装有仿古皮革封面。

example.eg: He reached her in a single bound.
example.egtrans: 他一步就跳到了她面前。

example.eg: The bounds of his property were clearly marked.
example.egtrans: 这块地的边界被标示得很清楚。

example.eg: His enthusiasm for the subject knows no bounds.
example.egtrans: 他对该学科的热忱是毫无止境的。

example.eg: You left your wallet on the table; someone was bound to steal it.
example.egtrans: 你把钱包落在了桌上，肯定有人会去偷它。

example.eg: The puppy runs and bounds in the field.
example.egtrans: 小狗在空地上跑跑跳跳。

example.eg: Hedges bound the field on all sides.
example.egtrans: 绿篱围在空地四周。

example.eg: Workers bind the logs together before they are transported to the factory.
example.egtrans: 工人将木头捆起来后再运到工厂。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 捆绑 ， 捆扎, 束 ， 系

example.eg: Colleen binds her ankles for stability.
example.egtrans: 科林把脚踝紧紧地裹住来保持稳定。

example.eg: The outlaw bound and gagged the woman.
example.egtrans: 歹徒将女子捆绑并堵住她的嘴。

dsense.name: bind [sth]⇒
dsense.guideword: (provide a binding for a book, etc.)

example.eg: Arthur knows how to bind books; perhaps he can repair the cover on that one.
example.egtrans: 亚瑟知道如何装订书籍，说不定他能修好那本书的封面。

example.eg: The contract binds the signer to the above stipulations.
example.egtrans: 合同规定签署人必须遵守上述条款。

example.eg: That's a major bind Jeff's gotten himself into.
example.egtrans: 杰夫真是让自己深陷困境。

example.eg: The heroine of the novel struggles to escape the binds of her low social class.
example.egtrans: 那部小说的女主人公奋力地想要摆脱底层社会阶级对她的束缚。

example.eg: These molecules bind with proteins to make glycoproteins.
example.egtrans: 这些分子依附蛋白质生成糖蛋白。

example.eg: Mix the butter and flour well so that they bind.
In this recipe, the eggs bind to the flour.
example.egtrans: 这份菜谱中写到，鸡蛋要跟面粉和在一起。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 粘在...上, 与…和在一起

example.eg: Gymnasts with long hair usually bind it before competitions.
example.egtrans: 长发的体操选手赛前通常会将头发扎起来。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 用带子扎, 用带子绑

dsense.name: bind [sth]
dsense.guideword: (finalize or seal an agreement) (交易、协议等)

example.eg: The couple bound their marriage by exchanging rings.

dsense.name: bind [sb]⇒
dsense.guideword: (constrain by loyalty or obligation) (受忠诚、使命感等影响)

example.eg: His close-knit network of friends and colleagues bind Tom to the university.
example.egtrans: 在亲密朋友和同事圈的影响下，汤姆不得不去上了大学。

example.eg: The contract binds Isabel's activities under the agency for a period of 5 years.
example.egtrans: 按照合同的约束，伊莎贝尔必须为该机构效力5年。

example.eg: The traditional method of sewing in this village involves binding garments in a decorative way.
example.egtrans: 这座村庄传统的缝纫方式是通过装饰性的方式给服饰锁边。

dsense.name: bind [sb]⇒
dsense.guideword: archaic, often passive (bind out: employ as an apprentice)

example.eg: William was bound to a blacksmith at the age of 11.
example.egtrans: 威廉姆11岁时成为铁匠学徒。

example.eg: My mother is bedridden with severe arthritis.

dsense.name: bound hand and foot, tied hand and foot

example.eg: The kidnappers left him bound hand and foot in the trunk of the car.
example.egtrans: 绑匪将他的手脚捆绑起来，扔在汽车的后备箱里。

dsense.name: be bound hand and foot, be tied hand and foot

example.eg: The criminal was bound hand and foot so he couldn't escape.
Every child is bound hand and foot by their parents' rules.
example.egtrans: 每个孩子都被自己父母的规矩完全束缚。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 被完全束缚的, 被严格约束的

example.eg: That boy is so reckless, he's bound to end up in jail.  The vase that was balanced on the edge of the table fell off, which was bound to happen.
example.egtrans: 那个男孩行事太过鲁莽，最后一定会进监狱的。不出意料，摆在桌子边缘摇摇欲坠的花瓶摔到地上了。

example.eg: The footballer limped off the pitch, clutching his bound-up leg.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 久坐不动的, 伏案工作的

example.eg: After twelve months at sea, Connor was homeward bound again.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 回家的, 回国的, 回国的

example.eg: Admiral Shovell was sailing homeward bound from the Mediterranean.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 向家, 向本国, 向本国

dsense.name: ironbound, iron-bound, iron bound
dsense.guideword: archaic, figurative (coast: covered with rocks) (海岸)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 大块肌肉的, 肌肉强壮的
